name: ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Mix design to be selected based on pavement material investigation. Binder application rates to be confirmed with client prior to start.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - The surface level of the area to be stabilised shall be confirmed to be within level tolerances prior to commencement of stabilisation. Unless otherwise specified, +15/-25mm.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Quicklime & Hydrated Lime to meet requirements of AS1672. Cement supply to comply with AS 3972. ALI shown on delivery dockets.

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Binder shall be spread at the specified rate. In passes not exceeding 15kg/m2. No traffic to be allowed after spreading other than construction traffic. Matt test & load cell outputs recorded for QA purposes.

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - If quicklime is used it shall be slaked with sufficient water to allow full slaking to take place prior to mixing. Full slaking will be deemed to have been achieved when all quicklime that has been spread has changed from a cream coloured granulate to a fine white powder and there is a cessation of rising vapours.

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Mixing shall commence as soon as practical after spreading of the cementitious binder. Water to be added as required to achieve and maintain close to optimum moisture content. Mixing depth to be physically checked.
INSPECTION / TEST METHOD - Visual/ QA report
RECORD OF CONFORMITY - Visual/ QA report
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Compaction of the stabilised layer shall commence immediately after mixing.
○ All compaction shall be completed within the times specified in Table VR 307.052 after addition of the cementitious binder.

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - On completion of initial rolling, the stabilised material shall be trimmed to the specified surface tolerances. Water may be applied during this operation to replace evaporated moisture.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Stabilised layers shall pass test rolling in accordance with Section 173, prior to acceptance of the layer.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - If required, density testing to be undertaken as per table 307.151 or otherwise specified
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Surface shall be kept moist and protected from damage by traffic and construction activities until further pavement layer is applied.
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the FH’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.
